content: Are pritty printed string and output of toMessageData equal?

String is just a list of codepoints, encoded in UTF-8.
Format adds formatting options, such as indentation, formatting groups and potential positions to insert line breaks in order to make sure that it can be printed in a column-width-aware way
MessageData adds context data like goal state and environment and as such allows for printing expressions (Lean.Expr) and goal states (Lean.MVarId) in such a way that you can hover over them.

Given (optional) context information you can use Lean.MessageData.format to turn MessageData into Format and given column width and starting position you can use Std.Format.pretty to turn Format into a String.
Thank you. I'll do some research on my own based on the hints you gave me.
Asei Inoue has marked this topic as resolved.
